Denis KopylovContacts

Arrival is a UK startup focused on full developemnt cycle of zero-emission vehicles. It's one of the largest UK tech companies with $13 billion valuation.

My role

I joined the team as a Lead Designer at the end of 2021. Since then I'm responsible for all customer support interactions. I formulate user scenarios, conduct UX researches, negotiate with core stakeholders, and support devs with implementation.

Chat & full customer information

Product

The core two products we design are internal agent space and customer support page. They require whole different approaches, yet should be simple and straightforward to use.

Agent chats & customer FAQ

Data dilemma

We have a bunch of services under the hood. Sure we can show all info about a customer. But we may overload an agent with details. That’s why we highlight user current scenario. If we see a customer is in a ride, it’s likely her question connected with this ride.

User in different flows

Research insights

We conducted interviews with our agents and supervisors. It appeared that most of support systems suffer from lack of information. So we came with an idea to enrich our smart block with links to different data pages.

Block are links to full data pages
Full data page example

Hub definition

Sometimes you have to dive into a problem and search something not entirely connected to a customer. To cover these needs we designed pages for tickets, users, and vehicles. With search, deliberate filters, and highlight blocks.

Tickets page
Users pages
Vehicles page

Outcomes

For me, It's a project which requires a deep understanding of whole company processes. Starting from our business model to vehicles hardware parts. I had a lot of stake holders meetings and collaboration workshops with other teams. As for our team results, we implemented MVP version of an agent portal. Also, we're constantly improving user Help & Support portal experience.
